rooms.name: South of the Cyan House
rooms.description: You find yourself south of a Cyan House, weathered by constant winds.

rooms.name: East of the Cyan House
rooms.description: You are east of the Cyan House, surrounded by plains.

rooms.name: North of the Cyan House
rooms.description: You are north of the Cyan House, where an open window sits on the wall.

rooms.name: West Room
rooms.description: You climb through the open window, into the sad-looking house. A doorframe, but no door, is to the east.

rooms.name: East Room
rooms.description: In the east room sits a magnificent table adorned with a bottle of water, some bandages, and an ancient tome.

rooms.name: West of the Cyan House
rooms.description: You are west of the Cyan House where a cobbled trail leads toward an abandoned city plaza.

rooms.name: Town Plaza
rooms.description: You find an abandoned city plaza. A broken-down fountain sits to the north, and a small clearing is to the south.

rooms.name: Tarnished Fountain
rooms.description: You marvel at a broken-down fountain, with worthless, scattered coins upon it. You see a shabby-looking bridge further north.

rooms.name: Plaza Outskirts
rooms.description: You stand at the edges of the isolated town plaza. The rushing River of Souls run at your feet.

rooms.name: Bridge of Lost Souls
rooms.description: You stand upon the Bridge of Lost Souls. You feel your soul trying to wrench itself from your body.

rooms.name: Castle Grounds
rooms.description: You stand upon the castle crossroads, gazing around the imperial courtyard. The castle steps are north, a bridge to the west, and a hidden path is to the east.

rooms.name: Overgrown Path
rooms.description: You follow the winding path along the boreal forest. The path continues from the south to the northeast, but you stop at a weathered sign. 'WELCOME to YUKON TERRITORY'

rooms.name: Castle of Alaskan Cheese
rooms.description: You stand before the tall, bronze castle doors. They're unlocked, but you soul beckons for you to keep quiet.

rooms.name: Frostbitten Tundra
rooms.description: You stand alone in an icy tundra, tickled by a layer of fresh snowflakes. The path continues from the northwest to the east, where you can see the faint glow of a log cabin.

rooms.name: Snowy Cabin
rooms.description: You stand at the door to the log cabin, blanketed by recent snowfall. The sign above the door reads: 'Best Furs in ALL OF CANADA'.

rooms.name: Fur Store
rooms.description: You enter the cabin. Instantly, the warmth rejuvenates your soul.

rooms.name: Border Gate
rooms.description: You stand between the thick pearled gates leading to the Castle. There is a small patrol booth, but it seems to be deserted. You can see a lake to the south.

rooms.name: Clock Lake Lookout
rooms.description: You stand on the shoreline of an enormous lake. An oaken dock, to the southeast, extends further upon the water.

rooms.name: Clock Dock
rooms.description: You swing your sullied boots off the edge of the pier. A harmonious feeling washes over you.

rooms.name: Gates of Hell
rooms.description: You stand before the gnarled, towering gates, with dread imbued within your soul. Inexplicably, the door to the underground tunnel seems to be locked with an arcane incantation.

rooms.name: Door Sanctuary
rooms.description: You stand upon a crossroads of doors, in every cardinal direction. One catches your eye, to the north.

rooms.name: Mystery Door of Mystery
rooms.description: You peer at the worn-down door with a sense of terror. Several unearthly-coloured jewels emblazon its edges. It is unlocked, but you feel you will perish from its hands.

rooms.name: Lower Hall of Enemies
rooms.description: You stand before a battered room; it is scattered with skulls of presumptuous warriors from days of yore.

rooms.name: Upper Hall of Enemies
rooms.description: The upper hall seems vastly different. The floors and walls are a pristine, tiled white, with no death in sight.

rooms.name: Alaskan Castle Foyer
rooms.description: You stand in the centre of a large foyer, decorated in an ornate Victorian-Alaskan aesthetic. A large staircase leads to the ruling family's private quarters.

rooms.name: Upper Atrium
rooms.description: Standing far above the foyer, you feel lightheaded. You can hear faint snoring, but you can't tell if it comes from the east or the west.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom
rooms.description: You enter the master bedroom of the Princess of Alaskan Cheese. She's engrossed within a deep sleep in an expensive, marble four-poster bed. Her face reminds you of Ms. Dybala. A leather-bound diary sits on her bedside table, with one page bookmarked.

rooms.name: Cheese Vault
rooms.description: You enter the prestigous cheese vault, containing many precious Alaskan Cheeses locked within its grasp.

rooms.name: South of Crater
rooms.description: You are south of a large, bottomless crater. Looking down into the black abyss fills you with terror.

rooms.name: West of Crater
rooms.description: You are west of a large crater. In the distance, a gloomy fog enshrouds the land further westward.

rooms.name: Shrouded Grave
rooms.description: You are surrounded by a dark, misty fog. In front of you is a gravestone that reads: 'Scell E. Ton'.

rooms.name: The Lair
rooms.description: You are in a huge cave. A pile of rocks sit at your feet.

rooms.name: North of Crater
rooms.description: You are standing north of the crater, in front of a large cavern. A terrifying, animalistic roar emanates from within.

rooms.name: East of Crater
rooms.description: You stand within the boundaries of the cavernous and forested lands. To your west is a large cavern. To your east is the endless forest.

rooms.name: Mysterious Entrance
rooms.description: A boarded-up tunnel blocks the way before you. It seems to lead further westward, towards the base of the Table Caldera.

rooms.name: Underground Tunnel
rooms.description: You find yourself in a dank, moss-covered tunnel. Why are you doing this again?

rooms.name: Forest Tripoint
rooms.description: You are standing in a forest filled with tall pines. The thick overhead canopy blocks almost all sunlight through, replaced by a thick mist. You hear a wolf howl in the distance.

rooms.name: Small Clearing
rooms.description: The forest opens up into a clearing. Sunlight streams through the opening in the canopy. Flowers bloom on the forest floor and you catch a glimpse of a bunny here and there.

rooms.name: Campsite Ruins
rooms.description: The forest opens up into a desolate, looted campsite. The charred remains of fire start to gnaw at your resolve.

rooms.name: Great Cliff Lookout
rooms.description: You peer over the edges of an enormous cliff. You can almost see every nook and cranny of the land. Across the River of Souls, you see a huge ornate castle, a temple, and snow-covered lands. You are awestruck by the natural beauty of Tableland. You take a deep breath and bask in the beauty of what you are seeing. You stand there for a moment, and suddenly remember that you have a mission to fulfill.

rooms.name: Base of Mt. Tableland
rooms.description: You stand at the base of the towering Mount Tableland, the tallest mountain in the region. A historical building sits to its east, clearly inspired by Victorian architecture.

rooms.name: Parliament Steps
rooms.description: You stand on the steps of the Parliament of Tableland. It reminds you of the Ottawa Parliament Buildings, but you cannot remember what Ottawa is.

rooms.name: Bridge of Found Souls
rooms.description: You stand on a bridge over a rushing, powerful river. Glimpses of vibrant-coloured fish peek through the brooks. To the east, you can see a beautiful castle.

rooms.name: Parliament Entrance Room
rooms.description: In the Parliament of Tableland, no one seems to be here. Every desk and office room is empty. How does anyone do work around here? At the end of the room, there is a door with a sign reading "Tableland Department of Customer Service".

rooms.name: Dept. of Customer Service
rooms.description: The rooms looks like it with a hurricane. Paper shreds are littered all over the room. You talk, and hear your voice has gotten higher. You sound like a chipmunk. What could have caused this?

rooms.name: Teleporter Room
rooms.description: A hulking metal machine sits in the middle of the room. You suddenly remember something from machine class you took at Perfect City High School. The machine standing in front of you is a teleporter. Teleporters used to be all over Perfect City, before Quebec retaliated and vaporized it.

rooms.name: Dog Paradise
rooms.description: You feel your body being pulled and taken through time and space to land on a cloud. Living on the cloud and hundreds and hundreds of dogs.

rooms.name: Crossroads of Destiny
rooms.description: You stand at a crossroads. Far in the North, the Castle of Alaskan Cheese looms. To the West, the Temple of News News.

rooms.name: Temple Pavillion
rooms.description: You stand in the grounds of a huge, ornate temple. Its golden imperial exterior intimidates you.

rooms.name: News News Temple
rooms.description: You stand in a spacious temple entryway padded by praying mats. Books line every shelf and sunlight beams through the skylight. An ornate, gold door faces you from the other side of the room.

rooms.name: News News Vault
rooms.description: You stand in a large, beautiful vault. Gold coins pool at your feet.

rooms.name: Tableland Plains
rooms.description: You are in the plains of Tableland. The Cyan House is to the southwest, and the Temple of News News is to the East.

rooms.name: Shadowed Plains
rooms.description: Standing in the grassy knolls of Tableland, a huge cloud casts a shadow around you. You feel compelled to visit it, high in the sky.

rooms.name: Caldera Bridge
rooms.description: Up ahead is the towering Table Caldera, named for its table-like top. Standing on a brimstone bridge over lava is not pleasant.

rooms.name: Table Caldera Platform
rooms.description: The air around tightens its grip around your throat. But you've come too far to give up now. At least the view is nice from up here.

rooms.name: Volcano Peak
rooms.description: You feel your soul tremble as you gaze into the volcano. You know you have no choice.

rooms.name: Sky Temple Pavillion
rooms.description: You look up at the towering castle, perched on the cloudcapt sky. Its cathedral-like spires lurch toward the heavens, yearning for a taste. Several large stained-glass panes reveal your reflection. Despite everything, it's you.

rooms.name: Temple of the Sky Gods
rooms.description: You stand as small as a mouse in the Sky Temple's celestial throne room. A triad of towering, otherworldy thrones sit immaculate on the pristine marble tiling. On them sit three humans. Somehow, you know they are the true Gods of Tableland.

exits.adjacentRoom: Temple of the Sky Gods Pavillion

rooms.name: Gloomy Forest
rooms.description: Fog enshrouds your vision. You cannot see more than a few feet.
